questions.question: how high importance product's customer cart calls, customer rating, product cost, prior purchases, and discount offered are distributed across all dimensions.

answer.value:
Customer_cart_calls (2 to 7)Most values are concentrated at the top half of the axis.
Customer_rating (1 to 5)There is a wide spread, with a concentration of lines at the very top (5/5) and another cluster in the middle (around 3).
Cost_of_the_Product (96 to 310)The lines stretch across almost the entire axis.
Discount_offered (1 to 65) Most lines are clustered near the bottom of the axis.

key_insights: Lines that score high on "Customer_cart_calls" (value 7) often correspond to lower values on "Prior_purchases" (value 2)
The lines show a wide spread on the "Discount_offered" axis. One specific line extends all the way to the maximum value of 65 (presumably 65% discount)
Several lines peak sharply at the top of the "Customer_rating" axis (value 5) and also reach the top of the "Cost_of_the_Product" axis (value 310)

reasoning.reasoning: We care about high importance product's data
